page.title: 12Smugglers Inn Pevensey
page.content: Smuggling has been a common pursuit over the Pevensey Levels,many old buildings and public houses have stories of smugglers.Local museums exhibit aids to the smugglers'trade hollow fishing floats and other devices.Smuggling was very common in Pevensey despite the{Intervention men living in the rows of terraced houses still standing along the shore.In 1833 a gang landed with{French brandy. A fight took place as the smugglers tried to escape across the marshes.5 were captured and 3 reported dead.The public house,the{Smugglers Inn}is one place where the smugglers used to meet The present landlord, Mr. Phillips has been there only 2 years. The building about 600 years old has a cellar 12 by 20 foot.Eight staff run the pub which is very busy at holiday times.
